programmes.show_description: Oliver, who has Tourette's syndrome, hopes to bag his first ever girlfriend. Claire, who's usually surrounded by builders, wants to lay the foundations of a dream relationship.
On the box this time: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars, Holidaying with Jane McDonald, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment and Peaky Blinders.
Modern-day Lothario Lewis is bowled over by flight attendant Megan but his tried-and-tested techniques are nothing new for her. Daniel from Aberystwyth returns for a second date.
Baio and Switch: To get closer to Barry and Erica, Beverly promises to bring actor Scott Baio to town for a charity event. Adam gets into a tricky situation.
Double Dare: Adam and Emmy are excited when the producers of their favourite game show plan to hold auditions at their school.
The One with All the Darts: Hapless Liam wants his greatest passion to take flight with a darts-inspired wedding. Will his arrows extravaganza hit the target?
Celebrating 100 Years of Disney: The teams are challenged to construct builds that capture the emotion of a well-known scene from a Disney movie.
The One with All the Darts: Hapless Liam wants his greatest passion to take flight with a darts-inspired wedding. Will his arrows extravaganza hit the target?
The One at a Music Festival: Jake wants the ultimate wedding knees-up, but bride-to-be Rosie dreams of a more intimate affair. Will this festival wedding prove to be a headliner?
Rude Tube's naughty little sister presents a man pretending to be a walrus, an incredible downhill bike run and some computer keyboard hurling.
En Garde: The family supports Manny's new interest - fencing. It turns out he's pretty good at it, but Jay's proud enthusiasm triggers an old childhood wound for Mitchell.
Up All Night: Gloria isn't happy with Jay's reaction to the arrival of Javier, Manny's infamously unreliable dad. Phil is suffering from kidney stones.
Fifteen Percent: Mitchell seeks revenge when Jay introduces Cameron as just his 'friend'. Gloria gives Manny's date a makeover.
Fiesta Sunrise: A cockroach-infested kitchen means that the customers have to leave for their own safety at Fiesta Sunrise, a Mexican restaurant in West Nyack.
Sante La Brea: Gordon visits Sante La Brea, a health food restaurant in Hollywood. But there's nothing glamorous about this eatery as owner Dean faces financial ruin.
Cafe 36: Gordon Ramsay visits Cafe 36 in Chicago. Husband-and-wife team Terry and Carol are stuck in the past and their head chef's lax attitude is driving away customers.
Casa Roma: Gordon visits Casa Roma, the oldest restaurant in Lancaster, California. Although the bar is a success, the restaurant is failing and has had 20 chefs in two years.

programmes.show_name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programmes.show_description: (1992) Family comedy. Macaulay Culkin ends up in a swish New York hotel while his family are in Miami. But the burglars he defeated before (Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern) are back...
Boy-Scoutz 'n the Hood: During an all-syrup Squishee bender, Bart joins the junior campers, and ends up taking the embarrassing - and dangerous - Homer on a river rafting trip.
$pringfield (or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Legalized Gambling): Homer gets a job at Mr Burns' new casino and Marge gets addicted to the slot machines.
The Last Temptation of Homer: Homer falls for his beautiful new colleague Mindy Simmons (guest star Michelle Pfeiffer), who shares his love of doughnuts...
Lisa with an 'S': Homer loses a large sum of money playing poker with Broadway legend Laney Fontaine, who takes Lisa under her wing and transforms her into a showbiz kid.
Paths of Glory: Lisa sets out to restore the damaged reputation of Springfield's first female inventor. Bart convinces Marge and Homer that he has sociopathy.
Barthood: Bart's coming-of-age story is told, chronicling his life from youth to adulthood. But his tense relationship with Homer and being overshadowed by Lisa shape him.
The Girl Code: Marge posts a photo on social media that gets Homer fired, so he returns to his old job as a dish-washer in a Greek restaurant. Lisa creates an app.
Teenage Mutant Milk-Caused Hurdles: Bart is smitten with his new teacher and tries to impress her. Homer buys a new type of milk that has a strange effect on Bart and Lisa.
A collection of best bits as assorted famous faces enjoy top TV, from Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef to The 1% Club, Hijack, Antiques Roadshow and The Yorkshire Vet.
This time the Goggleboxers watch: The Inheritance, Long Lost Family, Unknown Number: The High School Catfish, The Yorkshire Vet, Dish It Out and Street Cops: Catching the Yobs.
What do the Goggleboxers think of MAFS UK, Slow Horses, Win Win, Made in Chelsea, Dolphins Up Close with Bertie Gregory, Waterloo Road and Top Guns: The Next Generation?
Can a self-confessed party animal who's looking for someone wild, a disco dancer, an ex-Playboy bunny and a biker daredevil find love in the First Dates restaurant?
Ex-market trader Dave meets Sara, whose last marriage lasted five days. Trendy Dennis and his date Chris wear matching trainers. And Ruth brings along 'Mike' - her colostomy bag.
This time the Goggleboxers watch: The Inheritance, Long Lost Family, Unknown Number: The High School Catfish, The Yorkshire Vet, Dish It Out and Street Cops: Catching the Yobs.
What do the Goggleboxers think of MAFS UK, Slow Horses, Win Win, Made in Chelsea, Dolphins Up Close with Bertie Gregory, Waterloo Road and Top Guns: The Next Generation?
The One with All the Darts: Hapless Liam wants his greatest passion to take flight with a darts-inspired wedding. Will his arrows extravaganza hit the target?
The One at a Music Festival: Jake wants the ultimate wedding knees-up, but bride-to-be Rosie dreams of a more intimate affair. Will this festival wedding prove to be a headliner?
Dodger sets out to prove that Smithy is corrupt. Vicky's confidence is crushed. And McQueen family members return as a series of 'what if' scenarios play out during a high-stakes situation.
Rude Tube's naughty little sister presents more clips, this time with a twist of karma. Featuring a fall into a river, a penalty kick back and an attempt to get dressed on a treadmill.
Up All Night: Gloria isn't happy with Jay's reaction to the arrival of Javier, Manny's infamously unreliable dad. Phil is suffering from kidney stones.
On the Same Paige: Phil's real estate class will be cancelled if any more students drop it. So he turns on his charm to try to convince one student, Paige, to stay.
Did the Chicken Cross the Road?: When Alex is up for a prestigious government job that requires a family interview, everyone tries too hard, which jeopardises her chances.
Putting Down Roots: Dede's husband Jerry comes to town to bequeath her possessions to the family. Mitch and Claire receive a little more of Dede than they know what to do with.
Stuck in a Moment: Haley wants to give the family a Christmas gift they'll never forget - if she can find the perfect time. Claire is mad when Phil borrows the Christmas tree.
The One with the Wannabe King: Harry wants to be king for the day. But bride Charlotte wants something low key. Will this be Harry's crowning moment or will it be 'off with his head'?
The One in an Old Mine: It's high noon for impulsive groom Steve as he plans a cliff-hanger of a Wild West wedding for Leona. Will Steve's nuptials on a bridge prove a swinging success?
Gordon Returns: Gordon Ramsay revisits some of the restaurants he set out to save, including The Mixing Bowl, The Olde Stone Mill, Peter's and Campania. Have things improved?
Spanish Pavillion: Gordon Ramsay visits Spanish Pavillion, a family-run restaurant whose owners, brothers Michael and Jerry, spend more time struggling for power than working.
Classic American: Best pals Colleen and Naomi bought Classic American in New York together, but their inexperience is pushing their friendship to the edge. Can Gordon help?
Down City: Gordon Ramsay tries to save struggling restaurant Down City in Providence, Rhode Island. But tough-talking owner Abby refuses to take advice from anyone.
(1997) Comedy sequel starring Alex D. Linz as a resourceful boy who's stranded at home with chickenpox when a top-secret military microchip comes his way. Can he keep it safe from crooks?
Homer the Vigilante: Homer sets up a chaotic vigilante group to combat one-man crime spree Molloy (guest star Sam Neill).
Bart Gets Famous: Thanks to his new catchphrase, 'I didn't do it', Bart becomes famous, getting his own TV series and releasing a range of merchandise.
Homer and Apu: When Apu loses the Kwik-E-Mart, he moves in with the Simpsons. And then Homer joins him on a pilgrimage to the first ever Kwik-E-Mart, in the Himalayas.
Lisa vs. Malibu Stacey: Lisa decides Malibu Stacey dolls set a bad example to girls, so she pleads with their creator, Stacy Lovell (Kathleen Turner), to design an alternative.
Brand new series - Full Heart, Empty Pool: Grampa and Homer accidentally invent a new sport while arguing in a drained pool. But trouble arrives when Big Avocado sponsors it.
Brand new series - Estranger Things: When Bart and Lisa lose interest in their only shared love, Marge worries they'll drift apart as they grow up. Cue a glimpse into the future.
(2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.
The Goggleboxers tune in to Bridgerton, SAS: Who Dares Wins, Freeze the Fear with Wim Hof, Made in Chelsea, and the news on Rishi Sunak and the Partygate scandal.
